member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Connection.ConnectionManager.WaitUntilNotDisconnectedAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Waits until the connection state is not Disconnected (i.e., Connecting, Connected, or Disconnecting). This is used by ConnectionWriterAsync which needs to be active during Connecting state to send CONNECT packets. Uses an event-driven signal instead of polling to avoid CPU waste during long disconnections.
member.param: The cancellation token.
member.returns: A task that completes when state is not Disconnected.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Connection.ConnectionManager.SignalNotDisconnected
member.summary: Signals that the connection state is not Disconnected (i.e., Connecting, Connected, or Disconnecting). This is called when state transitions from Disconnected to any other state.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Connection.ConnectionManager.ResetNotDisconnectedSignal
member.summary: Resets the not-disconnected signal. Called when state transitions to Disconnected.

member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.idisposable?view=net-6.0 Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside finalize and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: True if called from user code.

member.summary:
Event arguments for the event.
This event is called after a disconnect from the MQTT broker. This can be happen because of a call to or because of a failure.

member.name: T:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder
member.summary:
A builder for HiveMQClientOptions.
The HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder class is a builder pattern implementation that provides a convenient way to construct HiveMQClientOptions objects for configuring HiveMQClient connection to an MQTT broker. It offers methods to set various connection parameters such as the broker host, port, client ID, authentication credentials, TLS settings, clean start flag, keep-alive period, and more.
The builder allows for a flexible and customizable configuration of the HiveMQClient, enabling developers to create and customize the options based on their specific requirements.
Usage example:
var options = new HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder() .WithBroker("mqtt.example.com") .WithPort(1883) .WithClientId("myClientId") .WithAllowInvalidBrokerCertificates(true) .WithUseTls(true) .WithCleanStart(true) .WithKeepAlive(60) .WithAuthenticationMethod(AuthenticationMethod.UsernamePassword) .WithAuthenticationData(Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes("authenticationData")) .WithUserProperties(new Dictionary(string, string) { { "property1", "value1" }, { "property2", "value2" } }) .WithLastWillAndTestament(new LastWill { Topic = "lwt/topic", Message = "LWT message", QualityOfServiceLevel = MqttQualityOfServiceLevel.AtLeastOnce, Retain = true }) .WithMaximumPacketSize(1024) .WithReceiveMaximum(100) .WithSessionExpiryInterval(3600) .WithUserName("myUserName") .WithPassword("myPassword") .WithPreferIPv6(true) .WithTopicAliasMaximum(10) .WithRequestProblemInformation(true) .WithRequestResponseInformation(true) .Build();

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithBroker(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the address of the broker to connect to.
This can be either an IPv4 address, IPv6 address or a hostname.
member.param: The broker to connect to.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithWebSocketServer(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the WebSocket server to connect to.
This must be a fully qualified URI, e.g. "ws://localhost:8884/mqtt" or "wss://localhost:8884/mqtt".
member.param: The WebSocket server to connect to.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithWebSocketKeepAliveInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the WebSocket keep-alive interval.
This specifies the interval at which the WebSocket client will send keep-alive pings to the server to maintain the connection. If not set, the default WebSocket keep-alive behavior is used.
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).
member.param: The keep-alive interval.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithWebSocketRequestHeaders(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Sets custom HTTP headers to be sent during the WebSocket handshake.
This allows you to add custom headers such as Authorization, X-API-Key, or any other custom headers required by your WebSocket server. Headers are sent during the initial WebSocket connection handshake.
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).
member.param: A dictionary of header names and values.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithWebSocketRequestHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a custom HTTP header to be sent during the WebSocket handshake.
This is a convenience method for adding a single header. For multiple headers, use .
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).
member.param: The header name.
The header value.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithWebSocketProxy(System.Net.IWebProxy)
member.summary:
Sets the proxy configuration for WebSocket connections.
This allows you to configure a proxy server for WebSocket connections. If not set, the system's default proxy settings are used.
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).
member.param: The proxy configuration.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithPort(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the port to connect to.
Default ports are: - 1883 for non-TLS connections - 8883 for TLS connections - 1884 for non-TLS websocket connections (ws://) - 8884 for TLS websocket connections (wss://) .
member.param: The port to connect to.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithClientId(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the client identifier.
The Client Identifier is a mandatory parameter that must be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It is a unique identifier that identifies the MQTT client connecting to the broker. The Client Identifier allows the broker to distinguish and track individual clients and maintain their session state.
If a client identifier isn't specified, one will be generated automatically.
member.param: The client identifier.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithAllowInvalidBrokerCertificates(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether to allow invalid broker certificates.
In some cases, you may want to ignore and accept invalid broker certificates. If so, set this to true. This is useful for testing purposes, but should not be used in production.
member.param: Whether to allow invalid broker certificates.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithUseTls(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to use TLS when connecting to the broker.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithCleanStart(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether to use a clean start.
This flag indicates whether the client wants to start a new session or resume a previous session with the broker.
When the Clean Start flag is set to true, the broker discards any previous session state associated with the client and starts a new session. This means that the client will not receive any missed messages or subscriptions from previous sessions.
When false, the broker attempts to resume the previous session for the client. The broker will restore the client's subscriptions and deliver any missed messages that were published during the client's offline period.
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to use the clean start flag when connecting.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithKeepAlive(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the keep alive period.
This value specifies the maximum time interval, in seconds, between two control packets (PINGREQ and PINGRESP) sent by the client to the broker. The Keep Alive Period serves as a mechanism to ensure that the connection between the client and the broker remains active and detect any potential network or client failures. If the client does not send a control packet within the Keep Alive Period, the broker assumes that the client is no longer active and may terminate the connection.
By setting an appropriate Keep Alive Period, clients can maintain an active connection with the broker and prevent it from being closed due to inactivity. The Keep Alive Period should be set to a value that is less than the session expiry interval specified in the CONNECT packet to ensure the session remains active.
member.param: The keep alive period.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithAuthenticationMethod(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the authentication method.
member.param: The authentication method.
member.exception: Thrown when the authentication method is not between 1 and 65535 characters.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithAuthenticationData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the authentication data.
member.param: The authentication data.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithUserProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Adds a user property to be sent in the connect call.
In MQTT 5, User Properties provide a flexible way to include custom key-value pairs in MQTT messages. User Properties allow clients to attach additional metadata or application-specific information to messages beyond the standard MQTT headers and payload. These properties can be used for various purposes such as message routing, filtering, or conveying application-specific data. User Properties are optional and can be included in MQTT packets like CONNECT, PUBLISH, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE, and others. They enable extensibility and interoperability by allowing clients and brokers to exchange custom information in a standardized manner within the MQTT protocol.
member.param: The key of the user property.
The value of the user property.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithUserProperties(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Sets the user properties to be sent in the connect call.
In MQTT 5, User Properties provide a flexible way to include custom key-value pairs in MQTT messages. User Properties allow clients to attach additional metadata or application-specific information to messages beyond the standard MQTT headers and payload. These properties can be used for various purposes such as message routing, filtering, or conveying application-specific data. User Properties are optional and can be included in MQTT packets like CONNECT, PUBLISH, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE, and others. They enable extensibility and interoperability by allowing clients and brokers to exchange custom information in a standardized manner within the MQTT protocol.
member.param: The user properties to be sent in the connect call.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithLastWillAndTestament(HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestament)
member.summary:
Sets the last will and testament.
In MQTT 5, a Will Message, also known as the Last Will and Testament (LWT), allows a client to specify a message that will be published by the broker on behalf of the client when the client unexpectedly disconnects. The Will Message includes a topic, payload, QoS level, and retain flag. This feature is useful for clients to communicate their status or leave a message for others in case of an unexpected disconnection. It is an optional feature that clients can choose to use when establishing an MQTT connection.
member.param: The last will and testament.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithMaximumPacketSize(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum packet size in bytes.
the Maximum Packet Size is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It specifies the maximum size, in bytes, that the client is willing to accept for an MQTT packet from the broker. This value allows the client to limit the size of incoming packets to prevent excessive memory usage or denial-of-service attacks. The Maximum Packet Size is negotiated between the client and the broker, and the broker will ensure that packets sent to the client do not exceed this size. If the Maximum Packet Size is not specified by the client, the broker may impose its own limit or use a default value.
member.param: The maximum packet size in bytes.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithReceiveMaximum(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the receive maximum.
The Receive Maximum is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It specifies the maximum number of QoS 1 and QoS 2 messages that the client is willing to receive simultaneously from the broker. The Receive Maximum value allows the client to control the flow of incoming messages and prevent overwhelming its resources. By setting a specific Receive Maximum value, the client can limit the number of messages that the broker can send to it at any given time. If the Receive Maximum is not specified by the client, the broker may impose its own limit or use a default value.
member.param: The receive maximum.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithSessionExpiryInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the session expiry interval.
The Session Expiry Interval is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It specifies the maximum duration, in seconds, for which the broker should maintain the client's session state after the client disconnects. The Session Expiry Interval allows clients to control the lifespan of their session on the broker. If the client reconnects within the session expiry interval, the broker will resume the session and restore any relevant state information. However, if the client does not reconnect within the specified interval, the broker will consider the session expired and discard any associated state. If the Session Expiry Interval is not specified by the client, the broker may impose its own limit or use a default value.
member.param: The session expiry interval.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithUserName(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the username.
The Username is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It is used for authentication and represents the username or identifier associated with the client. The Username is typically used in conjunction with a password or other authentication mechanisms to verify the client's identity and grant access to the MQTT broker. The format and interpretation of the Username are specific to the authentication method being used, and it allows the broker to authenticate and authorize the client based on the provided credentials. If the client does not require authentication, the Username field may be omitted from the CONNECT packet.
member.param: The username value.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithPassword(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary:
Sets the password using a SecureString for enhanced security.
The Password is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It is used for client authentication in conjunction with the Username or other authentication mechanisms.
The Password field allows clients to provide a secret credential or authentication token associated with the provided Username. The format and interpretation of the Password are specific to the chosen authentication method and agreed upon by the client and the broker.
The broker will use the provided Password, along with the Username or other authentication information, to verify the client's identity and grant access to the MQTT communication based on the configured authentication rules.
If the client does not require authentication or the chosen authentication method does not involve a password, the Password field may be omitted from the CONNECT packet.
This method accepts a SecureString for enhanced security, preventing password exposure in memory.
member.param: The password as a SecureString for enhanced security.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithPassword(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the password using a plain string (for backward compatibility).
WARNING: This method stores the password as a plain string in memory, which is less secure. Consider using WithPassword(SecureString) for enhanced security.
The Password is an optional parameter that can be included in the CONNECT packet during the connection establishment process. It is used for client authentication in conjunction with the Username or other authentication mechanisms.
The Password field allows clients to provide a secret credential or authentication token associated with the provided Username. The format and interpretation of the Password are specific to the chosen authentication method and agreed upon by the client and the broker.
The broker will use the provided Password, along with the Username or other authentication information, to verify the client's identity and grant access to the MQTT communication based on the configured authentication rules.
If the client does not require authentication or the chosen authentication method does not involve a password, the Password field may be omitted from the CONNECT packet.
member.param: The password value as a plain string.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithPreferIPv6(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to prefer IPv6.
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to prefer IPv6.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithTopicAliasMaximum(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the topic alias maximum.
This value represents the maximum number of topic aliases that the client is willing to use in subsequent MQTT messages.
Topic aliases are a feature introduced in MQTT 5 to optimize network bandwidth by reducing the size of MQTT messages. Instead of repeating the full topic string in every message, the client and broker can use a shorter topic alias value to represent the topic. This reduces the payload size and improves overall message transmission efficiency.
The Topic Alias Maximum value indicates the highest topic alias number that the client can use. The actual value negotiated between the client and broker will be the minimum of the Topic Alias Maximum values specified by both parties.
member.param: The topic alias maximum.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithRequestResponseInformation(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether to request response information.
This value indicates whether the client requests the broker to provide response information in certain MQTT control packets.
When the Request Response Information flag is set to true, the client is indicating its interest in receiving additional information from the broker in response to specific MQTT control packets. This information can include response codes, reason strings, and user properties.
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to request response information.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithRequestProblemInformation(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether to request problem information.
This value indicates whether the client requests the broker to provide additional information in case of errors or problems encountered during the MQTT communication.
When the Request Problem Information flag is set to true, the client is indicating its interest in receiving detailed information from the broker when errors or problems occur. This information can include error codes, reason strings, and user properties associated with the encountered issues.
By setting the Request Problem Information flag, the client can receive more specific and helpful information from the broker, aiding in troubleshooting and understanding the nature of any encountered problems during the MQTT communication.
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to request problem information.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.HiveMQClientOptionsBuilder.WithAutomaticReconnect(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether to automatically reconnect.
This value indicates whether the client should automatically reconnect to the broker in case of a connection failure or disconnection.
When the Automatic Reconnect flag is set to true, the client will attempt to automatically reconnect to the broker if the connection is lost or disconnected unexpectedly. The client will continue to retry the connection at increasing intervals until the connection is re-established successfully.
By enabling the Automatic Reconnect feature, clients can ensure that their MQTT communication remains robust and resilient to network disruptions or temporary outages. The client will automatically recover from connection failures and resume communication with the broker without manual intervention.
member.param: A boolean indicating whether to automatically reconnect.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestamentBuilder.WithWillDelayInterval(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the Will Delay Interval. This value is the delay the broker should wait before publishing the Last Will and Testament message.
If the Will Delay Interval is absent, the default value is 0 and there is no delay before the Will Message is published.
Odd Fact: the maximum value of this option equates to a 136 year delay. (2^32 - 1) seconds = 136 years.
member.param: The delay value in seconds.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestamentBuilder.WithPayloadFormatIndicator(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the Payload Format Indicator. This value indicates the format of the payload. The value is a single byte with the following possible values:
0 UTF-8 Encoded Character Data
1 Binary Data
If the Payload Format Indicator is absent, the default value is 0.
member.param: The PayloadFormatIndicator value.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestamentBuilder.WithPayloadFormatIndicator(HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PayloadFormatIndicator)
member.summary: Sets the Payload Format Indicator. This value indicates the format of the payload. The value is a MQTT5PayloadFormatIndicator enum.
member.param: A value from the MQTT5PayloadFormatIndicator enum.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestamentBuilder.WithMessageExpiryInterval(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the Message Expiry Interval. This value is the time in seconds that the broker should retain the Last Will and Testament message.
If the Message Expiry Interval is absent, the default value is 0 and the message is retained until the Session ends.
Odd Fact: the maximum value of this option equates to a 136 year delay. (2^32 - 1) seconds = 136 years.
member.param: The delay value in seconds.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.LastWillAndTestamentBuilder.WithContentType(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the Content Type. This value is a UTF-8 encoded string that indicates the content type of the payload.
The value of the Content Type is defined by the sending and receiving application.
member.param: The payload content type.

member.name: T:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions
member.summary: A class to manage the MQTT options available in the Client.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.WebSocketServer
member.summary:
Gets or sets the WebSocket server address to connect to.
The WebSocket server address must include the protocol such as ws:// or wss://.
Examples: ws://localhost:8000/mqtt wss://localhost:8884/mqtt .

members.member:
Gets or sets a value that represents the session expiration interval in use by the MQTT broker.
In order to implement QoS 1 and QoS 2 protocol flows the Client and Server need to associate state with the Client Identifier, this is referred to as the Session State. The Server also stores the subscriptions as part of the Session State. The session can continue across a sequence of Network Connections.
The Session State lasts as long as the latest Network Connection plus the Session Expiry Interval.
We use long here because uint in C# is non CLS compliant. The value range is unsigned 4 byte integer (uint).

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.ClientReceiveMaximum
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum number of QoS 1 and QoS 2 publications that this MQTT client is willing to process concurrently.
The Client uses this value to limit the number of QoS 1 and QoS 2 publications that it is willing to process concurrently. There is no mechanism to limit the QoS 0 publications that the Server might try to send.
The value of Receive Maximum applies only to the current Network Connection. If the Receive Maximum value is absent then its value defaults to 65,535.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.ClientMaximumPacketSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum packet size that the MQTT client is willing accept. If not set, no limit is imposed beyond the protocol maximum (4.294.967.295).
The valid range of values are 1..4_294_967_295 equivalent to a 32-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.ClientTopicAliasMaximum
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the highest value that the Client will accept as a Topic Alias sent by the Server.
The Client uses this value to limit the number of Topic Aliases that it is willing to hold on this Connection. A value of 0 indicates that the Client does not accept any Topic Aliases on this connection.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.WebSocketKeepAliveInterval
member.summary:
Gets or sets the WebSocket keep-alive interval.
This specifies the interval at which the WebSocket client will send keep-alive pings to the server to maintain the connection. If not set, the default WebSocket keep-alive behavior is used.
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.WebSocketRequestHeaders
P:HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions.WebSocketProxy
member.summary:
Gets or sets the proxy configuration for WebSocket connections.
This allows you to configure a proxy server for WebSocket connections. If not set, the system's default proxy settings are used.
This option is only applicable when using WebSocket transport (ws:// or wss://).
Example:
options.WebSocketProxy = new WebProxy("http://proxy.example.com:8080");

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithTopic(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the topic of the publish message.
An MQTT topic is a string-based identifier used for message communication in MQTT. It represents a specific subject or category to which messages can be published or subscribed. Topics are structured as a series of levels separated by forward slashes ("/"), allowing for hierarchical organization. Clients can publish messages to specific topics, and other clients can subscribe to topics of interest to receive those messages. Topics enable flexible and targeted message routing in MQTT communication.
member.param: The topic.
member.exception: Thrown when the topic is null or empty.
Thrown when the topic length is greater than 65535 characters.
Thrown when the topic contains wildcard characters.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithQualityOfService(HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.QualityOfService)
member.summary:
Sets the Quality of Service level of the publish message.
Quality of Service (QoS) levels define the reliability and guarantee of message delivery between MQTT clients and brokers. The choice of QoS level depends on the specific requirements of the application. QoS 0 is suitable for scenarios where occasional message loss is acceptable, while QoS 1 and QoS 2 are preferred for applications that require reliable and guaranteed message delivery.
member.param: The Quality of Service level from the `QualityOfService` enum.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithRetain(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the retain flag of the publish message.
The retain flag in an MQTT publish message is a property that indicates whether the broker should retain the last message published on a specific topic. When a message with the retain flag set is published, the broker stores the message and delivers it to new subscribers immediately upon their subscription. This allows new subscribers to receive the most recent message published on a topic, even if they were not subscribed at the time of publication. The retain flag is useful for transmitting important information or status updates that should be available to new subscribers.
member.param: The retain flag.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithDuplicate(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the duplicate flag of the publish message.
The duplicate flag in an MQTT publish message is a property that indicates whether the message is a duplicate of a previous message. It is used to ensure message delivery reliability in scenarios where the sender needs to retransmit a message. When a message is sent or retransmitted, the duplicate flag is set to inform the receiver that the message may have been previously received. The receiver can then handle the message accordingly, such as ignoring duplicates or processing them as needed. The duplicate flag helps prevent unintended message duplication and ensures the correct handling of messages in MQTT communication.
member.param: The duplicate flag.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithResponseTopic(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the response topic of the publish message.
In MQTT 5 publish, the response topic is an optional property that the publisher can include in the message. It specifies the topic to which the recipient should send a response or acknowledgement related to the published message. The response topic allows for request-response communication patterns, where the publisher can indicate where the response should be sent. This enables more advanced message exchange scenarios and facilitates bidirectional communication in MQTT 5.
member.param: The response topic.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithCorrelationData(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Sets the correlation data of the publish message.
Correlation data in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that allows the sender to include additional contextual information or identifiers related to the message. It is typically used to correlate or associate the message with other data or processes in the system. Correlation data can be any arbitrary byte sequence and is useful for tracking or linking messages with specific operations or workflows. It enables more advanced message processing and coordination in MQTT communication.
member.param: The correlation data as a byte array.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithCorrelationData(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the correlation data of the publish message.
Correlation data in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that allows the sender to include additional contextual information or identifiers related to the message. It is typically used to correlate or associate the message with other data or processes in the system. Correlation data can be any arbitrary byte sequence and is useful for tracking or linking messages with specific operations or workflows. It enables more advanced message processing and coordination in MQTT communication.
member.param: The correlation data as a string.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithContentType(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the content type of the publish message.
The content type in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that specifies the type or format of the payload data being published. It provides additional information about the content of the message payload, allowing the receiver to interpret and process the data accordingly. The content type can be used to indicate the MIME type, media type, or any other format identifier that helps the receiver understand how to handle the payload. It enables more flexible and context-aware message processing in MQTT communication.
member.param: The content type.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithMessageExpiryInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the message expiry interval of the publish message.
The message expiry interval in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that specifies the maximum duration for which the message should be considered valid. It allows the sender to set a time limit on the message's relevance and ensures that outdated or expired messages are not delivered to subscribers. If a message's expiry interval is reached before it is delivered, the broker will discard the message instead of delivering it. The message expiry interval helps maintain message freshness and relevance in MQTT communication.
member.param: The message expiry interval.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithSubscriptionIdentifier(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the subscription identifiers of the publish message.
The subscription identifier in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that associates the message with a specific subscription made by the client. It allows the sender to include an identifier that uniquely identifies the subscription for which the message is intended. This identifier helps the receiver to match the incoming message with the corresponding subscription, enabling more efficient and targeted message delivery. The subscription identifier enhances the scalability and performance of MQTT communication by reducing the need for extensive topic matching operations.
member.param: The subscription identifier.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithSubscriptionIdentifiers(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Sets the subscription identifiers of the publish message.
The subscription identifier in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that associates the message with a specific subscription made by the client. It allows the sender to include an identifier that uniquely identifies the subscription for which the message is intended. This identifier helps the receiver to match the incoming message with the corresponding subscription, enabling more efficient and targeted message delivery. The subscription identifier enhances the scalability and performance of MQTT communication by reducing the need for extensive topic matching operations.
member.param: The subscription identifiers.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithTopicAlias(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the topic alias of the publish message.
The topic alias in an MQTT 5 publish message is a property that allows the sender to include a previously defined topic alias instead of the full topic name. It is used to reduce the size of the message and improve network efficiency by avoiding the repetition of the full topic name. The topic alias is a short integer value that corresponds to a topic name previously defined in a Topic Alias Maximum packet. It enables more efficient message transmission and delivery in MQTT communication.
member.param: The topic alias.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.PublishMessageBuilder.WithUserProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a user property of the publish message.
In MQTT 5, User Properties provide a flexible way to include custom key-value pairs in MQTT messages. User Properties allow clients to attach additional metadata or application-specific information to messages beyond the standard MQTT headers and payload. These properties can be used for various purposes such as message routing, filtering, or conveying application-specific data. User Properties are optional and can be included in MQTT packets like CONNECT, PUBLISH, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE, and others. member.summary: Gets the Session Expiry Interval in use by the MQTT broker for this connection.
member.returns: The Session Expiry Interval in seconds or null if unspecified.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Results.ConnectResult.BrokerReceiveMaximum
member.summary:
Gets the maximum number of QoS 1 and QoS 2 publications that the MQTT broker is willing to process concurrently for this client.
If the Receive Maximum value is absent, then its value defaults to 65,535. It does not provide a mechanism to limit the QoS 0 publications that the Client might try to send.
member.returns: The integer value of the maximum number of QoS 1 + QoS 2 concurrent messages.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Results.ConnectResult.BrokerMaximumPacketSize
member.summary:
Gets the Maximum Packet Size the MQTT broker is willing to accept.
If the Maximum Packet Size is not present, there is no limit on the packet size imposed beyond the limitations in the protocol as a result of the remaining length encoding and the protocol header sizes.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.Client.Results.ConnectResult.MaximumQoS
member.summary:
Gets the maximum the maximum quality of service (QoS) that this MQTT broker supports.
QoS 0 (At Most Once Delivery) = The message is delivered according to the capabilities of the underlying network. The message arrives at the receiver either once or not at all.
QoS 1 (At Least Once Delivery) = Ensures that the message arrives at the receiver at least once.
QoS 2 (Exactly Once Delivery) = The highest Quality of Service level, for use when neither loss nor duplication of messages are acceptable.
member.returns: The maximum Quality of Service level supported by the MQTT broker.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Transport.TCPTransport.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.idisposable?view=net-6.0 Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside finalize and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: True if called from user code.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Transport.WebSocketTransport.#ctor(HiveMQtt.Client.Options.HiveMQClientOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HiveMQ client options containing WebSocket server URI and configuration.
member.exception: Thrown when the WebSocket URI scheme is invalid (must be "ws://" or "wss://").

remarks.para: This constructor configures the WebSocket transport with the MQTT subprotocol. The "mqtt" subprotocol is required for MQTT over WebSocket connections as specified in the MQTT specification. The WebSocket server must support this subprotocol for the connection to succeed. If the server does not support the "mqtt" subprotocol, the WebSocket handshake will fail and the connection will be rejected.
For secure WebSocket connections (wss://), TLS options are automatically configured based on the provided , including client certificates and certificate validation settings.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.Client.Transport.WebSocketTransport.AdvanceTo(System.SequencePosition)
member.summary: Advances the reader's examined position to the specified position.
member.param: The position to advance the consumed position to.

remarks.para: This method is a no-op for WebSocket transport. The AdvanceTo method is part of the API used by TCPTransport for buffering and backpressure management.

WebSocket transport does not use the Pipelines API because the WebSocket API provides its own message framing and buffering. Messages are read directly from the WebSocket connection and returned as complete buffers. There is no need to track consumed/examined positions since each read operation returns a complete message boundary.

member.name: T:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties
member.summary: MQTT version 5 properties as defined in https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901027.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.SessionExpiryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the session expiration duration in use by the MQTT broker.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.AssignedClientIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the Client Identifier which was assigned by the Server because a zero length Client Identifier was found in the CONNECT packet.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.ServerKeepAlive
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating the session expiry duration.
If this value is set, this overrides any Keep Alive sent in the Connect request.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of the authentication method.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Gets or sets a byte array containing authentication data.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.ResponseInformation
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that is in response to the RequestResponseInformation flag in the connect request.
If null, RequestResponseInformation wasn't set or it is not supported by this MQTT broker.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.ServerReference
member.summary:
Gets or sets a String which can be used by the Client to identify another Server to use.
The Server uses a Server Reference in either a CONNACK or DISCONNECT packet with Reason code of 0x9C (Use another server) or Reason Code 0x9D (Server moved).

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that is a human readable string designed for diagnostics.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.ReceiveMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum number of QoS 1 and QoS 2 publications that the MQTT broker is willing to process concurrently.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.TopicAliasMaximum
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the highest value that the Server will accept as a Topic Alias sent by the Client.
The Server uses this value to limit the number of Topic Aliases that it is willing to hold on this Connection. A value of 0 indicates that the Server does not accept any Topic Aliases on this connection.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.MaximumQoS
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum "Quality of Service" level that the MQTT broker is willing to accept.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.RetainAvailable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the MQTT broker supports Retained Messages.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a Dictionary containing the User Properties returned by the MQTT broker.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.MaximumPacketSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum packet size that the MQTT broker is willing accept.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5Properties.WildcardSubscriptionAvailable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Server supports Wildcard Subscriptions.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.Topic
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic of this Publish.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Quality of Service level for this publish.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.PayloadFormatIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the Payload Format Indicator. This is used to indicate the format of the payload.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.MessageExpiryInterval
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Message Expiry Interval. The Message Expiry Interval is the the lifetime of the Application Message in seconds.
If absent, the Application Message does not expire.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.TopicAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets the Topic Alias. A Topic Alias is an integer value that is used to identify the Topic instead of using the Topic Name.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.ResponseTopic
member.summary:
Gets or sets a UTF-8 Encoded String which is used as the Topic Name for a response message.
See also Request / Response.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.CorrelationData
member.summary: Gets or sets the binary data that is used by the sender of the Request Message to identify which request the Response Message is for when it is received.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the User Properties for this Publish.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.SubscriptionIdentifiers
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Subscription Identifiers for this Publish.
Multiple Subscription Identifiers will be included if the publication is the result of a match to more than one subscription, in this case their order is not significant.
The Subscription Identifier can have the value of 1 to 268,435,455. It is a Protocol Error if the Subscription Identifier has a value of 0.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets a UTF-8 Encoded String describing the content of the Application Message.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.Payload
member.summary: Gets or sets the UTF-8 encoded payload of this Publish.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.PayloadAsString
member.summary: Gets or sets the Payload as a string.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.Retain
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this publish should be retained by the MQTT broker.
If the Payload contains zero bytes it is processed normally by the Server but any retained message with the same topic name will be removed by the broker and any future subscribers for the topic will not receive a retained message. A retained message with a Payload containing zero bytes will not be stored as a retained message on the broker.
See Retain.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.Duplicate
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this packet is a retransmission.
This value is only used for QoS 1 and QoS 2 messages.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.MQTT5PublishMessage.Validate
member.summary: Validate that the options in this instance are valid.
member.exception: The exception raised if some value is out of range or invalid.

member.name: T:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.QualityOfService
member.summary: MQTT delivers Application Messages according to the Quality of Service (QoS) levels defined in the following sections.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.QualityOfService.AtMostOnceDelivery
member.summary:
The message is delivered according to the capabilities of the underlying network. The message arrives at the receiver either once or not at all.
AKA: Fire and forget.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.QualityOfService.AtLeastOnceDelivery
member.summary: Ensures that the message arrives at the receiver at least once.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.QualityOfService.ExactlyOnceDelivery
member.summary: The highest Quality of Service level, for use when neither loss nor duplication of messages are acceptable.

member.name: T:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.RetainHandling
member.summary: Defines the Retain Handling options for a subscription as defined in the MQTT Specification.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.RetainHandling.SendAtSubscribe
member.summary: Send retained messages at the time of the subscribe.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.RetainHandling.SendAtSubscribeIfNewSubscription
member.summary: Send retained messages at subscribe only if the subscription does not currently exist.

member.name: F:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.RetainHandling.DoNotSendAtSubscribe
member.summary: Do not send retained messages at the time of the subscribe.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.Subscription.TopicFilter
member.summary: Gets the topic filter for the subscription.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.Subscription.MessageReceivedHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the message handler for the subscription.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.Subscription.SubscribeReasonCode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the reason code (result) for the subscribe call.
See SubAckReasonCode or the
MQTT specification for more information.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.Subscription.UnsubscribeReasonCode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the reason code (result) for the unsubscribe call.
See UnsubAckReasonCode or the
MQTT specification for more information.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.Topic
member.summary:
Gets or sets the topic for this filter.
The Topic is a UTF-8 encoded string that specifies a subscription topic. It can include the wildcard characters # and + as defined in
the MQTT specification.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.QoS
member.summary: Gets or sets the Quality of Service level for this filter.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.NoLocal
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the broker will forward messages published by the client to the client itself.
The default value is false: the broker will forward all messages to the client.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.RetainAsPublished
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Application Messages forwarded using this subscription keep the RETAIN flag they were published with.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.RetainHandling
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether retained messages are sent when the subscription is established. This does not affect the sending of retained messages at any point after the subscribe.
The default value is RetainHandling.SendAtSubscribe. See
the MQTT specification for more information.

member.name: M:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.TopicFilter.ValidateFilter
member.summary: Validates the filter.
member.exception: Raised if the topic filter is invalid.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.VariableByteInteger.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this variable byte integer.

member.name: P:HiveMQtt.MQTT5.Types.VariableByteInteger.Length
